title: Endoscopic sleeve gastrectomy
abstract: Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) has become a leading indication for liver transplantation. Bariatric surgery is a proven intervention for weight loss and metabolic improvement in MASH but concerns over surgical risk in patients with advanced liver disease has expanded interest in endoscopic sleeve gastroplasty (ESG) as a less invasive alternative. This review examine the efficacy, safety, and metabolic impact of ESG
